com.topcoder.util.objectfactory
Interface SpecificationFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
ConfigManagerSpecificationFactory
public interface SpecificationFactory

Interface to the factory that will supply specifications. Currently there is one implementation - ConfigManagerSpecificationFactory. There are no restrictions on the constructors or the way the specifications are assesmbled before or during the call.

Version:
2.0
Author:
codedoc, mgmg

Method Summary
 ObjectSpecification getObjectSpecification(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String identifier)
          Obtains an ObjectSpecification from the Source, using a key and an identifier.
 

Method Detail

getObjectSpecification

public ObjectSpecification getObjectSpecification(java.lang.String key,
                                                  java.lang.String identifier)
                                           throws UnknownReferenceException

Obtains an ObjectSpecification from the Source, using a key and an identifier. Typically the key will be the class name, and the identifier would identify the specific configuration for this class. However, the can be any String that the Source understands, and the identifier then becomes optional. In other words, the source can use one or two keys to uniquely identify an configuration for an object.

Parameters:
key - key to the object specification
identifier - additional identifier to an object specification
Returns:
An object specification
Throws:
UnknownReferenceException - If the key/identifier combination is not recognized
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is null or empty
